name: Automagicalinks
author: Saul Baizman

sections.description: This WordPress plugin automagically converts text in the body of your pages whose name corresponds to webpages on your website into links. For example, if you have a webpage entitled “Foo Bar” on your website, when the words “Foo Bar” appear in the text of a page named “Hello World,” the words will automatically be linked to the “Foo Bar” webpage.
sections.installation:
1. Upload the automagicalinks folder to the /wp-content/plugins/ directory.
  2. Activate the plugin through the ‘Plugins’ menu in WordPress.
  3. Go to Settings > Automagicalinks to enable and configure the plugin.
sections.faq:
Installation Instructions

  1. Upload the automagicalinks folder to the /wp-content/plugins/ directory.
  2. Activate the plugin through the ‘Plugins’ menu in WordPress.
  3. Go to Settings > Automagicalinks to enable and configure the plugin.

short_description: Automagically convert text to internal links on your website.
description: This WordPress plugin automagically converts text in the body of your pages whose name corresponds to webpages on your website into links. For example, if you have a webpage entitled “Foo Bar” on your website, when the words “Foo Bar” appear in the text of a page named “Hello World,” the words will automatically be linked to the “Foo Bar” webpage.
